basics.name: Nan An
basics.label: Ph.D. Applicant in Algorithmic Game Theory & Optimization
basics.summary: Senior undergraduate (Rank 1/61) with first-author publications at AAAI 2025 (Oral) and NeurIPS 2025. Research focuses on EconCS, Optimization, and LLM-based multi-agent systems.

location.address: Gaoling School of AI, Renmin University of China

work.name: Industry Collaboration @ A Leading Tech Company
work.summary: Tackled the multi-campaign budget allocation problem in dynamic markets. Designed an Online Algorithm to maximize total delivery rate under strict ROI constraints, addressing issues of premature stopping and low utilization.
highlights: Designed Online Algorithm for real-time budget redistribution across heterogeneous campaigns.
Maximized total budget utilization while satisfying performance constraints.

work.name: Research Assistant @ RUC-EconCS Lab (Advisor: Prof. Qi Qi)
work.summary: Led the NeurIPS project on ad attribution mechanisms.
highlights: Proposed Peer-Validated Mechanism (PVM), the optimal DSIC mechanism in homogeneous settings.
Addressed incentive misalignment in Last-Click Mechanism (LCM) using a Game-Theoretic model.

work.name: Research Assistant @ RUC-EconCS Lab

highlights: Designed the first IC & IR mechanisms (G-FIX & G-CHANGE) for multi-slot ranking.
Proved approximation ratios (4/5Â³ for G-FIX, 1/2 for G-CHANGE).
